titleStmt.title: James H. Embry et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1733

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Richmond Ky
December 28/63
Hon. Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned respectfully recommend to your Excellency the appointment of J. W. Harcourt to fill the vacancy occasioned by the resignation of James Black as Justice of the Peace in District No 1 for Madison County, and the appointment of William Willis to fill the vacancy occassioned by the resignation of Thomas M. Hart in District No 8 for said county.

Very Resply
James H. Embry
C. F. Burnam
J. W. Caperton
J. W. Baum P J M C C
Will Roan
G. E. Billingsley County Atty
